business.headline: Government may approve Rs 30,000 crore support to maintain LPG price stabilityThis move is aimed at helping oil marketing companies recover losses they have been facing on domestic LPG sales due to high international prices.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 10:07 am, the Sensex was down 496.21 points at 80,127.05, while the Nifty stood at 24,444.55, lower by 151.60 points.

Retail inflation likely dropped to an eight-year low in July: ReportDespite uneven monsoons, a strong spring harvest has helped India keep a lid on food prices, extending the country's longest disinflationary streak in more than a decade.

Sensex, Nifty tumble as Trump's threat on trade deal spooks Dalal StreetAt the opening bell, the S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points and was trading 310.53 points lower at 80,312.73 around 9:35 am. The broader Nifty50 index also slipped 84.55 points to 24,511.60.

Trump rules out trade talks with India amid tariffs: Will Dalal Street face the heat?With Donald Trump ruling out any negotiations "until it is resolved," Dalal Street could witness a turbulent period as geopolitical tensions spill into the market.

Trump's tariff: What Indian refiners stand to lose if Russian oil stops flowingFor over two years, Indian refiners have been taking advantage of discounted Russian crude. But with the US tightening its stance, that door may soon begin to close.

US targets one-kilo gold bars with new import tariffs: ReportFollowing the US government's announcement last week of a broad 39% tariff on imports from Switzerland, this exacerbates already existing trade tensions between Bern and Washington.

Trump tariffs: US consumers face price hikes across major brandsIn the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble said it plans to raise prices on 25% of its North American products due to the impact of tariffs and product innovation.

Despite war and warnings, US traded more with Russia than ally UkraineUS President Donald Trump alleges that India has been financing the Russian invasion of Ukraine by importing oil. However, data by the US Census Bureau presents a different picture.

How India plans to tackle Trump's tariff threatIndia has already held five rounds of trade talks with the US, but no deal has been reached. The talks failed mainly because of disagreements over opening India's farm and dairy sectors, and the issue of buying oil from Russia.

Indian refiners hit pause on Russian oil imports after 50% tariff blow: ReportRefiners like Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation have decided not to buy Russian oil on the spot market in the upcoming buying cycle.

entertainment.headline: Allu Arjun steps out for a family dinner in Mumbai, shields daughter from camera flashesAllu Arjun was seen in a protective fatherly role as he shielded his daughter from paparazzi flashes during a family dinner in Mumbai. Videos and pictures from their recent outing, accompanied by Lakshmi Manchu, are now on the internet.

Are Saiyaara co-stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda dating? | Exclusive 'Saiyaara' has shattered box-office records and brought its leads, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, under the media spotlight. They were recently seen at a boutique, which fuelled rumours about their relationship.

Arabia Kadali review: Krish Jagarlamudi's sincere drama struggles to stay afloatRelease Date:Fri Aug 08, 2025'Arabia Kadali' series review: 'Arabia Kadali' presents a heartfelt and sincere retelling of a real-life crisis, combining a grounded human story with thematic depth. While the intent is solid and the performances authentic, the series suffers from dated presentation, occasional cliches, and uneven emotional engagement.

Robert Pattinson's Batman Part II to begin filming in 2026, release pushed to 2027Warner Bros Discovery confirmed 'The Batman Part II' to film in 2026, aiming for a 2027 release. Directed by Matt Reeves, it stars Robert Pattinson.

Salakaar review: Naveen Kasturia's nuclear spy drama is intriguing but inconsistentRelease Date:Fri Aug 08, 2025Salakaar series review: 'Salakaar' is a spy thriller inspired by real India-Pakistan nuclear espionage events. The series mixes political intrigue with flawed spy characters, offering a slow-burn drama with some logical lapses.

Himesh Reshammiya becomes first Indian artist on Bloomberg's Pop Power ListHimesh Reshammiya has made history as the first Indian artist to feature on Bloomberg's Pop Power List. He secured the 22nd spot with global pop icons, Post Malone, Bruno Mars and Beyonce leading the list.

Hansal Mehta's Gandhi, first ever series, to premiere at Toronto Film festivalHansal Mehta's series 'Gandhi' became the first Indian series to debut at the Toronto International Film Festival. AR Rahman, who has composed the music, announced the news on his official social media pages.

Lokesh Kanagaraj's full-circle moment: Once a bus conductor's son, now directing oneDirector Lokesh Kanagaraj's upcoming film, 'Coolie', features Rajinikanth in the lead role. Before the release of the film, let us take a look at the inspiring story of the filmmaker, who, without formal training, managed to direct some of the greats of Tamil cinema.

MS Dhoni and Coolie composer Anirudh play Padel at Chennai court. Viral videoMahendra Singh Dhoni and composer Anirudh Ravichander were seen playing Padel at the cricketer's newly launched court in Chennai. A video of them is going viral on social media.

Skydance seals $8 billion merger with Paramount after lawsuit dealSkydance finalised an $8 billion merger with Paramount, gaining control of major media assets. The deal follows political controversy and signals a shift in strategy under new CEO David Ellison.

Saiyaara casting director Shanoo Sharma reveals why Ahaan Panday refused to meet her'Saiyaara' casting director Shanoo Sharma shared an interesting anecdote about actor Ahaan Panday. Sharma recalled when Panday once refused to meet her due to his own fears.

Kamal Haasan meets PM Modi, seeks support for recognition of Keeladi's antiquityActor and Rajya Sabha MP, Kamal Haasan met Prime Minister Narendra Modi to seek expedited recognition of Keeladi's antiquity. He highlighted the need to promote Tamil civilisation and language on a global stage.

Centre issues notice to Marathi film 'Khalid Ka Shivaji' makers amid ban callsThe I&B ministry has issued a notice to the makers of the Marathi film Khalid Ka Shivaji following protests over the secular portrayal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the movie.

The Thursday Murder Club trailer: Veteran sleuths lead the probe on mysterious deathNetflix released the trailer for The Thursday Murder Club, a mystery film based on Richard Osman's bestselling novel. The story follows four retirees who solve cold cases, leading to a thrilling murder investigation on their doorstep.

Jolly LLB 3: Saurabh Shukla teases courtroom chaos with two JollysGet ready for chaos as 'Jolly LLB 3' returns with Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi, alongside Saurabh Shukla as Judge Tripathi. The teaser will release on August 12,

When Farida Jalal warned Shruti Seth not to correct big stars on Fanaa setActor Shruti Seth recalls Farida Jalal's playful warning during 'Fanaa' shoot and shares her experience working with Aamir Khan and Kajol.

Aamir Khan not involved in Coolie Hindi release, confirms production teamActor Aamir Khan's appearance in superstar Rajinikanth's much-awaited film 'Coolie' is only a goodwill gesture. Contrary to recent reports, a statement by the actor's team on Thursday stated that he is not involved in the film's distribution and has not made any calls.

I'm done chasing stars: Sunil Darshan opens up on choosing newcomersDirector Sunil Darshan, in an exclusive interaction with India Today, spoke about casting newcomers in his upcoming film 'Andaaz 2'. He even reflected on his past collaborations with prominent stars.

Elnaaz Norouzi declines Rs 6 crore offer to participate in Bigg Boss 19 : ExclusiveActor Elnaaz Norouzi turned down a Rs 6 crore offer to participate in Salman Khan-hosted 'Bigg Boss 19.' A source close to the development cited the actor's professional commitments behind the decision.

general news.headline: Kapil Sharma's cafe attacked over invite to Salman Khan, reveals audio clipKapil Sharma's Canada cafe attacked over Salman Khan invite, reveals audio clip of Bishnoi gang member

Trump drops another bomb, halts trade talks with India amid tariff rowThe US president ruled out trade negotiations with India after imposing a 50% tariff on Indian imports over its Russian oil purchases. India criticised the move as unfair and hit back at the double standards.

India-Russia bear hug is another Trump self-goalThough India and Russia had strong ties, New Delhi was trying to balance that as relations with the US were on the upswing. However, Donald Trump's tariff bazooka might see India's Russia hug get tighter. Russian President Putin is set to visit New Delhi later this year. Trump has, ironically, driven India towards Russia like the US did with its arms embargo in the mid-60s.

Murder of actor Huma Qureshi's cousin on CCTV, wife seen trying to interveneActor Huma Qureshi's cousin Asif was stabbed over a parking spot dispute in Delhi. He was then taken to the nearest hospital in a critical condition, where the doctors declared him dead.

Cheer for Mohammed Siraj, but don't jeer Jasprit Bumrah England vs India: Mohammed Siraj's brilliance at The Oval deserves every decibel of praise. But that celebration need not come at the cost of Jasprit Bumrah, the architect of several Indian triumphs.

Retail inflation likely dropped to an eight-year low in July: ReportDespite uneven monsoons, a strong spring harvest has helped India keep a lid on food prices, extending the country's longest disinflationary streak in more than a decade.

Trumpian Tariffs on India: Who pays? Who gains?Tariff liberalisation has been a factor leading to consumption growth in India, which has again been the prime driver of its economic growth. It is therefore important that India should shed off its protectionist status and rather actively accelerate efforts to diversify trade partners beyond the US and strengthen ties with other global players.

1,00,250 vote chori: Rahul Gandhi's presentation at INDIA bloc dinner meetAt the core of the discussions was a detailed presentation by Rahul Gandhi titled "Democracy Destroyed," in which he briefed the INDIA bloc leadership on alleged booth-level electoral frauds.

Sholay@50: The Making of Gabbar, Bollywood's Greatest VillainWhat made Gabbar Singh the greatest villain in Bollywood history? It wasn't just Amjad's performance, though his raw intensity was undeniable. It was the magic of Salim-Javed's writing, Sippy's vision, and Amjad's ability to transcend the archetype of the Bollywood villain.

Why additional Trump tariffs will be a big pain point for IndiaThe extra 25 per cent 'ad valorem' duty on Indian imports—seen as a new negotiating tactic by the Trump administration—will have a sizeable impact on India's growth in the short term

Who after Bumrah and Siraj? Is India's fast-bowling assembly line drying up?With Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj now past 30, the big question looms: who takes over as the leader of India's pace attack? Among the frontrunners are Arshdeep Singh, Akash Deep, Prasidh Krishna, and Harshit Rana - all promising, but yet to fully cement their place.

JD Vance went on kayak trip on birthday. Military secretly raised river levelThe Secret Service raised water levels in Ohio's Little Miami river for Vice President JD Vance's birthday kayaking trip, prompting criticism over taxpayer spending and comparisons to past political privileges.

Give the bully an inch…: China envoy to India slams Trump over tariffsThe remarks by the Chinese ambassador to India are being seen as expressing solidarity with countries like India and Brazil, who have been at the receiving end of Trump's aggressive tariffs.

Rahul Gandhi's 3-state fake voter charge: The curious case of Aditya SrivastavaRahul Gandhi had presented the EPIC number of a person named Aditya Srivastava from Lucknow claiming that in addition to Karnataka, he was also a voter in UP. He even displayed his face, photograph, and EPIC number during the presentation. Not only that, he also claimed that this person appeared on the voter list of Maharashtra.

Dining solo might be the best thing you do this weekNext time you feel awkward about going on a solo date, know that eating alone can be really refreshing. It helps you slow down, enjoy your food, and connect with yourself.

GPT-5 explained: What it can do and why it matters for ChatGPT users in 5 pointsOpenAI's GPT-5 is smarter, more accurate, and more personal than any previous ChatGPT model, bringing major improvements in coding, writing, health advice, and reasoning – plus a Pro version for the toughest challenges.

China's opposition clear: India finds an unlikely ally as Beijing slams US tariffsThe strong response came after US President Donald Trump signed an executive order placing an additional 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, taking the total import duty to 50 per cent.

Where 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' lived, silence now falls over a shattered valleyThe same landscapes that drew director Raj Kapoor to create a cinematic ode to purity, love, and nature now lie devastated in the aftermath of a deadly flash flood.

These things will happen: Trinamool leader after pregnant BJP supporter assaultedAn eight-month-pregnant woman was allegedly attacked at her home in Cooch Behar. The incident has sparked political blame game between Trinamool Congress and the BJP.

Chest pain, strokes, severe bleeding: These emergencies need an ambulance, not a driveRecognising true medical emergencies can save lives by ensuring timely treatment. Knowing when to call an ambulance versus driving can prevent irreversible harm.

Rukmini Vasanth exudes royalty as Kanakavathi in Kantara Chapter 1. Poster outActor Rukmini Vasanth joined Rishab Shetty's much-awaited film 'Kantara Chapter 1' on Friday. Her first-look poster, which exuded royalty, was shared by Shetty on social media. 'Kantara: Chapter 1' will release in cinemas on October 2.

Salman Khan visits bodyguard Shera's house after his father's death to offer condolencesSalman Khan was seen arriving at bodyguard Shera's Mumbai home late Thursday night to offer condolences after the death of his father, Sunder Singh Jolly. Jolly died of cancer at 88.

sports.headline: Cheer for Mohammed Siraj, but don't jeer Jasprit Bumrah England vs India: Mohammed Siraj's brilliance at The Oval deserves every decibel of praise. But that celebration need not come at the cost of Jasprit Bumrah, the architect of several Indian triumphs.

18-year-old Victoria Mboko stuns Naomi Osaka to win Canadian OpenVictoria Mboko staged a stunning comeback after losing the first set to beat Naomi Osaka 2-6, 6-4, 6-1 in the final. The 18-year-old became the first Canadian to defeat three former Grand Slam champions in a single WTA event in the Open Era

Gambhir assured my son that he will get chances: Abhimanyu Easwaran's fatherAbhimanyu Easwaran's father, Ranganathan Easwaran, has revealed that India head coach Gautam Gambhir has assured his son of getting chances in the playing XI. Abhimanyu couldn't find a place in the playing XI in the five-match Test series against England.

Dinesh Karthik hits back at Bumrah's critics: India's defeats are not his faultFormer India cricketer turned commentator Dinesh Karthik has slammed Jasprit Bumrah's critics, saying that it's not his fault that India lost Test matches in England despite his presence.

Who after Bumrah and Siraj? Is India's fast-bowling assembly line drying up?With Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj now past 30, the big question looms: who takes over as the leader of India's pace attack? Among the frontrunners are Arshdeep Singh, Akash Deep, Prasidh Krishna, and Harshit Rana - all promising, but yet to fully cement their place.

Pakistan Cricket Board suspends Haider Ali amid UK criminal investigation: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has provisionally suspended cricketer Haider Ali after it emerged that the 24-year-old batter is under criminal investigation by Greater Manchester Police in the United Kingdom.

Chennai Grandmasters 2025: Erigaisi takes dominant win, Keymer downs SarinArjun Erigaisi kicked off his Chennai Grandmasters campaign with a dominant win over Awonder Liang, while Vincent Keymer stunned Nihal Sarin in the opening round of this high-stakes tournament.

Ashes 2025: Glenn McGrath backs Australia to whitewash England 5-0Legendary pacer Glenn McGrath predicts a 5-0 Ashes whitewash for Australia in the 2025–26 series. McGrath's confidence stems from Australia's strong bowling lineup and favourable home conditions, posing a tough challenge for England.

Shikhar Dhawan pens emotional post for son Zoraver during WCL stintIn a heartfelt post, Shikhar Dhawan opened up about his son Zoraver, offering a rare glimpse into a deeply personal side of his life. Sharing a series of previously unseen photographs, the cricketer reflected on fatherhood, separation, and the small moments that continue to linger long after they've passed.

2nd Test: Henry eclipses Taylor's return as New Zealand take control on Day 1Matt Henry continued his outstanding form with another five-wicket haul as New Zealand took firm control of the second Test in Bulawayo, bowling Zimbabwe out for 125 and reaching 174 for 1 in reply by stumps on the opening day.

Duleep Trophy: Jurel to lead Central Zone, Karun left out amid Test returnDhruv Jurel is set to lead Central Zone in the upcoming Duleep Trophy campaign. The spin-bowling unit will have Kuldeep Yadav leading the line alongside Harsh Dubey and Manav Suthar.

Chennai Grandmasters 2025: Erigaisi takes dominant win, Keymer downs SarinArjun Erigaisi kicked off his Chennai Grandmasters campaign with a dominant win over Awonder Liang, while Vincent Keymer stunned Nihal Sarin in the opening round of this high-stakes tournament.

Ashes 2025: Glenn McGrath backs Australia to whitewash England 5-0Legendary pacer Glenn McGrath predicts a 5-0 Ashes whitewash for Australia in the 2025–26 series. McGrath's confidence stems from Australia's strong bowling lineup and favourable home conditions, posing a tough challenge for England.

Shikhar Dhawan pens emotional post for son Zoraver during WCL stintIn a heartfelt post, Shikhar Dhawan opened up about his son Zoraver, offering a rare glimpse into a deeply personal side of his life. Sharing a series of previously unseen photographs, the cricketer reflected on fatherhood, separation, and the small moments that continue to linger long after they've passed.

2nd Test: Henry eclipses Taylor's return as New Zealand take control on Day 1Matt Henry continued his outstanding form with another five-wicket haul as New Zealand took firm control of the second Test in Bulawayo, bowling Zimbabwe out for 125 and reaching 174 for 1 in reply by stumps on the opening day.

Duleep Trophy: Jurel to lead Central Zone, Karun left out amid Test returnDhruv Jurel is set to lead Central Zone in the upcoming Duleep Trophy campaign. The spin-bowling unit will have Kuldeep Yadav leading the line alongside Harsh Dubey and Manav Suthar.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
